intro: Ponthieva parvilabris, commonly known as the narrow-lipped ponthieva, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, spadix-bearing inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
